https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/63123/ : SUCCESS
I'm really surprised we're not just adding this to entity-manager.
Changed the code to read from "xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Item.Chassis" interface and display the chassisType in Redfish.
These numbers are meaningless, and shouldn't exist within bmcweb.  If this is the appropriate mapping, frudevice needs to publish it.
"xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Item.Chassis" interface is used to display the chassisType interface
This is getting the chassis type of ALL objects?  That seems wrong.
Why are we doing a mapper lookup for an interface that only FruDevice publishes?
Changed to "xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Item.Chassis" interface and display the chassisType in Redfish.
Please add that to the commit msg Tested statement. :)
This diff is now empty?  Please take a look.
I can able to see the diff.
Please provide your suggestions on this patch.
What about other implementation? Ed asked EM, could you explain the status quo via the EM stack?

These always map 1-to-1 D-Bus to Redfish? 
I would prefer we did something more like https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/master/redfish-core/lib/systems.hpp#L619
+1. Shouldn't do extra dbus calls to just get a property.

don't we need to map this? isn't this value like xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Item.Chassis.ChassisType.RackMount?

I don't think the D-Bus to Redfish is a complete 1v1 mapping 

From https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/v1/Chassis.v1_21_0.json

        "ChassisType": {
            "enum": [
                "Rack",
                "Blade",
                "Enclosure",
                "StandAlone",
                "RackMount",
                "Card",
                "Cartridge",
                "Row",
                "Pod",
                "Expansion",
                "Sidecar",
                "Zone",
                "Sled",
                "Shelf",
                "Drawer",
                "Module",
                "Component",
                "IPBasedDrive",
                "RackGroup",
                "StorageEnclosure",
                "Other"
            ],

What if the D-Bus property is set to Unknown? Won't that make the Redfish validator fail?

https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/blob/a1347418307d31a94bd21f22897aa508df938dcf/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/Inventory/Item/Chassis.interface.yaml#L39
I'm surprised that gitlint isn't upset by this, but can you add triple-backticks around some of this stuff?
If it gets set to Unknown, isn't this a Redfish validator error ? Leave off if Unknown ?

Yes, it is Redfish Validator error. I have referred the chassisType from PDI yaml file. Whether this needs to be removed here ?
Please provide your suggestions on this.

https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/blob/master/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/Inventory/Item/Chassis.interface.yaml
Added a comment to leave "Unknown" chassisType and return empty.

Hi Ed / Gunnar,

Please provide your suggestions/approval for this patch.

Thanks.
Seems reasonable, a couple small things
can we write switch case instead multiple if blocks
for just code clean up part

If is what I see elsewhere so I am okay with that.

It would be good if these could be enums thought like 
https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/a90323367863533ae3456ed2ee1baa705439eea9/redfish-core/lib/sensors.hpp#L103
this return can be define in default condition return in switch case
always best if you include like the ec, makes the LOG Message a lot more useful
We could keep the default in case this is set to "Unknown" or "Other" or the interface isn't implemented  but I am okay with this code as is.
